Posts.Content: Saw my urologist this week, go every year simply because by father had PC I have a relatively low PSA (1.1), but he noted on DRE that the prostate was assymetrical, said that is a red flag and said that it needs to be biopsied. I am 62 years old, no symptoms. I have it scheduled for next week, will be done in his office with local. I would appreciate any thoughts from the forum. Thanks.
Posts.Title: DRE to biopsy

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for the helpful advice. I have a relatively large teaching hospital nearby that performs the MRI/fused TRUS biopsies. I am scheduled with my URO for a TRUS this Tuesday, but am seriously considering calling the University Medical Center to inquire. Man, so much to consider, I do not have a URO there, but have a recommendation for a good one. Perhaps it would be prudent to cancel/reschedule the current biopsy and consult with the University center regarding availability and timing. If I do nothing, then it is TRUS Tuesday at 1 pm. On the other hand, my current Urologist has good instinct, just not access to latest technology. Again, appreciate the thoughts.
Posts.Title: DRE to biopsy

Posts.Content: Thank you Michael. Very helpful advice. I do have a teaching hospital nearby, and they do the MRI fused biopsies. Question, delay current TRUS scheduled for Tuesday and consult with University, or go ahead with TRUS? I have all the info, decision rests with me. I may call the University tomorrow am, see how long they take for a consult and a biopsy appt.
